__e: Nothing about you would surprise me.
You know, Peter, it's surprising how little I know about you... even though we've worked together for so long.
Can't say I'm tickled to see you alive, but I had a contingency plan.
It's all coming back to me now. Ungrateful redhead, rotten kids.
I'm wondering why you actually didn't become one.
I'm surprised you're not mad at me.
I'm not a policeman, but I can't imagine that you'd dismiss a suspect like him... just because he claimed he hadn't seen her.
Yes, but I'm rather surprised you didn't come to me first.
I'm surprised you didn't come here sooner.
I'm surprised your mother let you come to the big town.
Yes, but I'm rather surprised you didn't come to me first.
I'm surprised no one's thought of this...
I'm not surprised you're looking for him.
I'll tell you, it doesn't surprise me, the family putting somebody on this.
Your mother would choose Tuesday to get sick.
I'm not surprised to find you here.
I'd expect a comment like that from someone with no clearly defined pattern of faith.
And I must say that this doesn't surprise me one bit.
It doesn't surprise me that my father asked you to take me out.
I can see for myself you ain't as fit as you ought to be... and no wonder.
I' m surprised there's any of my boys left.
I don't understand how no one was killed.
I'm amazed at the end of each day that anybody's alive.
I don't know why we don't all have pneumonia.
Sometimes it surprises me that people even takes us seriously...
I'm surprised they put ME on the case, as it's going to create a big stir.
